intro: Chirita longgangensis var. hongyao, commonly known as the Hongyao Chirita, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with a unique red and green coloration. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within mountainous regions. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or white, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
